PARLIAMENT - 2012 22 2012 22, Thursday, 22nd March, 2012 - . . 1.00 . [ ] . . . 1.00 . [ ] . The Parliament met at 1.00 p. m., MR. SPEAKER [THE HON. CHAMAL RAJAPAKSA] in the Chair.
PETITIONS ( ) ( - , ) (The Hon. Vasudeva Nanayakkara - Minister of National Languages and Social Integration) , , , .. .
. Petitions ordered to be referred to the Committee on Public Petitions. ORAL ANSWERS TO QUESTIONS
: RAHULA GIRLS' SCHOOL MALABE : CHARGING OF MONEY
(i) the students of Subodhi Kanishta Vidyalaya administered by the Jayawardhanapura Zonal Education Office in the Colombo
District are admitted to Rahula Girls School in Malabe for Grade Six;
(ii) in admitting students to Grade Six, the Principal of that school charges Rs. 3,162 per student as facilities and other fees and issues receipts; and
(iii) another Rs. 6,000 purported to be the expenditure on desks and chairs is charged without issuing receipts, in addition to the aforesaid amount?
(i) whether the Principal of Rahula Girls School of Malabe has any authority to charge money in the aforesaid manner; and
(ii) if not, whether an investigation on the aforesaid charging of money would be carried out ?
( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Gamini Wijith Wijayamuni De Zoysa - Deputy Minister of Education) , .

: : PRINCIPALS OF GOVERNMENT SCHOOLS : LEADERSHIP TRAINING
(i) whether measures will be taken to hold a leadership training programme similar to the one held in army camps for university students, for the principals of Government schools as well;
(ii) of the reasons for giving principals such a training; and
(iii) whether suitable places have been selected to hold that programme?
(i) whether there are other institutions in our country at present which are suitable for providing training for principals in discipline and other matters; and
(ii) if so, the names of those institutions?
(iii) Will he admit that giving such a training may put the lives of principals suffering from various diseases and ailments at risk?
(c) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Gamini Wijith Wijayamuni De Zoysa) , .

Dayasiri Jayasekara) . . , . ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Bandula Gunawardane - Minister of Education) - ( ) (Mr. Speaker) . . . ( ) (The Hon. Bandula Gunawardane) .
asked the Minister of Economic Development:
(a) Will he inform this House of -
(i) the number of elephants and tuskers in the Elephant Orphanage at Pinnawala;
(ii) the number of male elephants, female elephants, male tuskers or female tuskers that have been obtained from the
Orphanage to make offerings or donations from 2005, up to date;
(iii) the names of the persons who obtained them in the aforesaid manner;
(iv) the names of the persons who made offerings or donations with the elephants obtained in the aforesaid manner;
(v) the temples, institutions or persons that received the aforesaid offerings or donations; and
(vi) the programme that has been launched to assure the security of the elephants and tuskers that have been offered or donated?
( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Lakshman Yapa Abeywardena - Deputy Minister of Economic Development) , .
( ) ( - , ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena - Minister of Water Supply and Drainage and Chief Government Whip) , .
: : SMALL TANKS IN AMPARA DISTRICT : REHABILITATION 2018/11 6. ...
() , ? asked the Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources Management:
(a) Will he state the steps taken by now to rehabilitate small tanks in the coastal areas of the Ampara District which have been in a state of ruin for the past 30 years?

(i) whether money has been obtained from the World Bank to rehabilitate the Senanayake Tank and surrounding small and medium scale tanks, dams and irrigation canals in the Ampara District, which is a major paddy cultivation area in Sri Lanka; and
(ii) whether he will submit the relevant details, if measures have been taken to commence the above mentioned rehabilitation activities?
(c) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) , . .
... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) , . ? ( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) ?

: : OWITIGAMUWA WATER SUPPLY PROJECT : MONEY SPENT 1583/11 8.
asked the Minister of Water Supply and Drainage:

(a) Is he aware that the Water Supply Project implemented by the Owitigamuwa North Nilwala Community Based Organization in the Kirinda Pahulwella Divisional Secretary's Division in the Matara District is defunct at present?
(i) the number of families that were provided with water by this project;
(ii) the total sum of money spent for this project; and
(iii) whether the funds for this scheme were generated from local or foreign sources?
(i) whether action will be taken to revive the Owitigamuwa Water Supply Project to cater to the drinking water needs of the residents of the area soon; and
(ii) if so, the date on which it will be started ?

. - . . : : VACANCIES FOR GRAMA NILADHARIS : APPOINTMENTS 1858/'11 10. ( ) (The Hon. Dayasiri Jayasekara) - (1):
asked the Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs:
(i) the number of candidates who passed the competitive examination held prior to 2011 for recruitment for the post of Grama Niladhari;
(ii) the number of persons who were granted Grama Niladhari appointments on the results of that examination; and
(iii) the cut-off mark considered in granting those appointments?
(i) whether action will be taken to appoint Samurdhi Development Officers for the vacancies that exist for Grama Niladharis;
(ii) if so, of the basis on which those appointments will be made; and
(iii) whether he admits that it is unfair to grant Grama Niladhari appointments to Samurdhi Officers disregarding those who have
passed the examination but not been granted appointments?
(c) If not, why? ... ( ) ( ... - , ) (The Hon. W.D.J. Senewiratne - Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs) , .

: : CULTIVATION OF DATE PALM : SOIL STUDY
asked the Minister of Local Government and Provincial Councils:

(a) Is he aware that the oblong, brown, sweet edible fruit date palm, Phoenix Dactylifera which is grown mostly in Western Asia and North African countries, is experimentally grown in the town of Kattankudy in the Batticaloa district and found to be successful?
(b) Will he state whether an extensive soil study is done in the areas that are suitable for establishing local date-palm cultivations?
( ) ( - , ) (The Hon. Indika Bandaranayake - Deputy Minister of Local Government and Provincial Councils) , .

... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) My first Supplementary Question is whether the Hon. Minister is aware that the oblong, brown, sweet, edible fruit date palm, Phoenix Dactylifera grown in Kattankudy in abundance was harvested recently by our Deputy Minister, the Hon. M.L.A.M. Hisbullah and the head of the Masjid al-Falah Moulana Moulavi Sheikh Abdulla Hazrat? ?
( ) ( - , ) (The Hon. Rohitha Abeygunawardana - Deputy Minister of Ports and Highways) , .
: : MATUGAMA WATER SUPPLY SCHEME : MONEY SPENT
asked the Minister of Water Supply and Drainage:
(a) Is he aware that the Matugama Water Supply Scheme was started in year 1999 under the Kalutara Integrated Rural Development Project?
(i) the total amount of money spent on the aforesaid water supply scheme;
(ii) whether the provisions for this project were provided through local funds; and
(iii) if not, whether provisions were provided through foreign aid?
(c) Will he inform of this House-
(i) the number of families expected to be provided with water through this project;
(ii) whether the aforesaid expected number of families can be provided with water at present;
(iii) whether allegations have been levelled that large scale financial frauds have taken place when the Matugama Water Supply scheme was implemented; and
(iv) if so, whether action will be taken to investigate into this matter?
: SOORIYAWEWA AND DAMBULLA CRICKET STADIUMS : SEATS
(i) the number of seats for spectators at Sooriyawewa Cricket Stadium in Hambanthota;
(ii) the amount spent on fixing one such seat;
(iii) the name of the institution that supplied those seats;
(iv) the amount for each seat supplied;
(v) whether tenders were called for the purchase of seats; and
(vi) if so, the names and addresses of those who submitted tenders, and the amounts offered, separately?
(b) Will he state the cost per seat at Dambulla Cricket Stadium Pavillion?

( ) (The Hon. Felix Perera) . . [3.25 p.m.] . ( . ) (The Hon. A. Vinayagamoorthy) Mr. Presiding Member, I was trying to bring in an Adjournment Motion during the last Sitting week and also during this week but because of a decision of the Party Leaders, I could not do that. I hope that at least in the future, I will get a chance to bring in an Adjournment Motion regarding some important matters in Jaffna.

Sir, I thank you very much for allowing me to speak on the Defence Services Command and Staff College (Amendment) Bill. Before I speak on that, I want to refer to the Gazette Notification of 6th March, 2012 issued by the President, which states, I quote:

By virtue of the powers vested in me by Section 12 of the Public Security Ordinance (Chapter 40), I, Mahinda Rajapaksa, do by this order call out all the members of the Armed Forces specified in the First Schedule hereto, for the maintenance of
public order in the areas specified in the Second Schedule hereto.

I am just asking this Government and the President whether this is the time for them to call out the armed forces. There is peace. It is because they act like that, we have gone to Geneva. Even the President is answerable to Parliament in terms of Article 42 of the Constitution. What is the necessity for him to call out the forces now? Is there a war? Are there any problems? What is the reason? I also want to find out from the Government as to when and how they declared an unofficial army rule in

Jaffna? What we have there is an army rule, not a civilian rule. Is it for this purpose that you are bringing in the army? I am just asking that. An army rule, not only do you find in Jaffna in the Northern Province, but in the other areas as well.

Now, what has the army done? Why is it that you have called out the forces? The Gazette Notification states for maintenance of public order. Can that not be done by the police? Is it necessary to call out the entire armed forces? I will tell you what the armed forces have done. For abductions, disappearances, unlawful arrests and white van arrests, who is responsible? I say that the Army Intelligence Unit and the people belonging to the army are doing this. When you commit a mistake several times, at least once, you will get caught. What happened to the Chairman of the Kolonnawa Urban Council? His brother was abducted only three days before the day on which it had been attempted to abduct him. Now, we know who is responsible or behind those white van arrests. Those continue to happen, not only here but everywhere, even in Jaffna.
For instance, todays "Daily Mirror" states, I quote:
Were Human Rights Activists Arrested? Court orders respondents to file objections by March 30.

Lalith Kumar Weeraraju and Kugan Murugananthan wanted to attend a procession that was to be held in Jaffna on the World Human Rights Day and on that day, they were abducted. Where are they now, I am asking?

Now, what has the Army got to do with the resettlement? That is what we are worried about. Take the Mullaitivu District. In the village of Keppapulavu which is close to Vattappalai, the army is not allowing resettlement of about 250 families. Vattapalai has been resettled but all the people in Vattapalai have got their agricultural lands in Keppapulavu and their cemetery is also there. What has the army got to do with this resettlement? His Excellency the President has made a declaration that there are no High Security Zones anywhere in the county and resettlement must be done by the respective Divisional Secretaries and the District Secretaries. So, why is the army preventing people from going and living in Keppapulavu? Again, from Mullivaikkal East and Mullivaikkal West, the army wanted the people to go and live at Kombavil. That is not the work of the army; the District Secretary or the Divisional Secretary will have to do that.

In Jaffna, I think you all know what has happened when we had a meeting at Alaveddi. Thank God! I was the first speaker and I got out of that place. But, the army came and assaulted the MPs and the people who were there. That is why we say we want a civilian rule. I know very well that we may not be in a position to get a suitable solution from this Government. That is another matter. But, what we ask is, at least give us a civilian rule. Why can you not do that?

In Valikamam North, there were about 47 villages which had to be resettled. Now, 24 villages have been resettled and another 23 villages have to be resettled including Miliddy from where KP hails. So, because the President has made a declaration that it is the work of the District Secretary, I wrote a letter to the GA, Jaffna to resettle these 23 villages in Valikamam North. She did not do anything; she forwarded that letter to the Commander of the Security of Forces with a copy to me. Why is the army dabbling in this resettlement? The Hon.Vinayagamoorthi Muralidaran, the Deputy Minister has said - if I remember correct - that even areas where civilians are living will be taken over for the use of the army camps. Is that the position of the Government?

What happened to Mr. Lasantha Wickrematunge? What happened to Mr. Prageeth Ekneligoda? Mrs. Ekneligoda was in Geneva yesterday. What happened to her? She was scolded and treated very badly, shabbily by those people who went there to protest against the Resolution. She has gone there to protest as her husband had been abducted. If I remember correct, the former Attorney-General, Mr. Mohan Peiris, has said that Mr. Eknaligoda is in a foreign country. I kindly request Mr. Mohan Peiris to tell this lady, who is in Geneva now, as to where Mr. Ekneligoda is.

Who has done this? The army. I say the army has done it. Again, in Mannar, some people have returned from India to settle down but they were chased away by the army. In Valigamam North, in Mathakal, some people have gone to clear their lands and set fire to the shrub jungles but the navy has assaulted them and chased them away. They have not only assaulted these people but they have also assaulted the Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman who was there. Is this the way you treat the people in Jaffna? Why can you not hand over the work to the GA there? Let her administer. Do not give it to the Security Force Commander, Mr. Hathurusinghe - [Interruption.] The GA is not doing it.

Then, regarding the disappearances of journalists, we know what happened to Mr. Lasantha Wickrematunge. What happened to Mr. Ekneligoda? He is missing. So, now what can we do? Why do you not bring in civil administration and control the army? Somebody must be having some sort of a group to do this work. This is the real problem we have got in Sri Lanka.

Just after the increase in the prices of petrol, kerosene and diesel - the price of kerosene was increased by Rs. 35 - people staged demonstrations. What happened? A fisherman was shot dead. I think our President must be thanked because due to what is happening in Geneva now, people have forgotten the real problems that they are facing. So, it is with regret I am telling you that the cost of living has gone up to such an extent, that in the last month, at Varani, a mother and daughter have committed suicide by jumping into a well because of poverty. I think

there will be an economic crisis in one or two months time and again the prices will go up. At that time, there will not be a Geneva issue. You will have to bring down the cost of living otherwise people might rise up. That is all I can say.

Finally Sir, my only request to the Government is, please give us a civilian rule. I know very well that you cannot give us a solution. So, at least give us a civilian rule and please demilitarize our areas as early as possible.

WRITTEN ANSWERS TO QUESTIONS : : PUBLIC SERVANTS : SALARIES
asked the Minister of Finance and Planning:
(i) separately, the way in which the number of public servants increased in each year during the period from year 1980 up to
(ii) separately, the way in which the cost of living index has increased in each year during that period ?
(b) Will he admit that the salaries of public servants have not been increased in proportionate to the rising cost of living ?
( ) ( - , ) (The Hon. Gitanjana Gunawardena - Deputy Minister of Finance and Planning)
(a) (i) The particulars of public servants from 2005 included in the Report of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka 2010 are tabled in the Parliament.
(ii) The particulars from 1980 to 2010 are mentioned in the Annexure.

The public servants are granted a special allowance of 5 per cent of their salary from 2011 taking the increasing cost of living into consideration and the Cost of Living Allowance is increased and paid every year. The monthly allowance thus paid at present in addition to the monthly salary is Rs.5,850
The public servants are provided healthcare facilities under Agrahara Insurance Scheme and the Government has rendered contribution in this regard.

The salary of the public servants has been increased by a high percentage with effect from 01.01.2006 compared to the previous year through the new salary scale implemented as per the Public Administration Circular 6/2006.

In addition, the public servants are provided various payments such as housing l o a n s , distress loans and festival advances in order to face the cost of living and to uplift the living condition of their families.

Steps have been taken by the Government to provide essential commodities and services at a convenient price at every possible chance. The essential consumables are provided at concessionary prices throughout the island by Lak Sathosa Boutiques and Co-operative Societies/Mini Co-op City Network.

A simple/single tax has been imposed in place of various taxes levied on 12 essential commodities as a measure to bring down the cost of living and it is revised timely taking the prices into consideration under the Special Commodity Levy Act, No. 48 of 2007.
In addition, import taxes on identified essential food items such as milk power and palm oil are cut off under the Section 19(A) of Customs Ordinance.
asked the Minister of Co-operatives and Internal Trade:
